section.title: Q1. Do I need an API key to use HelioNote?
section.p: Yes, all requests to the HelioNote REST API must be authenticated using an API key.

section.title: Q2. Where can I get my API key?
section.p: API keys can be generated from your HelioNote account dashboard.

section.title: Q3. What data format does the API use?
section.p: The API accepts requests and returns responses in JSON format

section.title: Q4. Are there rate limits?
section.p: Yes, the default rate limit is 100 requests per minute per API key. If you exceed the limit, youâ€™ll receive a 429 Too Many Requests error.

section.title: Q6. What happens if I delete a note?
section.p: Deleted notes are permanently removed and cannot be recovered.

section.title: Q7. Who can I contact for support?
section.p: You can contact the HelioNote support team at support@helionote.com.

section.title: Q8. Can I sort or filter my notes when fetching them?
section.p: Yes, you can use query parameters like ?sort=created_at_order;=desc or ?tag=work to filter results.

section.title: Q9. Does the API support pagination?
section.p: Yes, responses for large datasets are paginated. Use limit and offset query parameters to navigate through results.

section.title: Q10. Is the API versioned?
section.p: Yes, all endpoints include the version in the URL (e.g.,/v1/). This ensures backward compatibility as new versions are released.
